newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya shilling steady in higher turnover.
newsitem.headline: Kenya shilling steady in higher turnover.

text.p: TThe kenyan shilling held steady agains the dollar as a sudden increase in demand for dollars in was matched by higher export inflows, dealers said.
On Friday, the Central Bank of Kenya posted an unchanged shilling average of 55.40. Against the pound, the shilling was also unchanged, at 93.04.
Dealers told Reuters that over the week, the shilling appreciated as steady inflows from the agricultural sector, mainly tea and coffee exporters, streamed in.
But the market saw an erosion in the bullish shilling trend when the central bank intervened late on Thursday.
Another dealer said the central bank came into the market again on Friday morning, causing the shilling to drop slightly against the dollar.
The money market was liquid, with many banks lending. Overnight rates were quoted at around 10 percent levels from between five and 10 percent levels on Thursday.
